programmes.show_name: Movie Themes at the BBC: Volume 2
programmes.show_description: Some more of the greatest movie themes to light up the UK pop charts from the BBC's archives, including Lulu's To Sir with Love, Kate Bush's This Woman's Work and Lisa Loeb's Stay.
Performances of Bond theme tunes from the BBC archive, featuring Tina Turner, Dame Shirley Bassey, Matt Monro, Fun Lovin' Criminals, Adele, Sheena Easton, Garbage and a-ha.
6/8. SternTao double down on their short position, while Tender eyes US expansion. Contains very strong language and some scenes of a sexual nature.
Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.
7/15. Student Jasmine leads a seaside stroll along Whitley Bay. But will the weather and selfie school make it thumbs up or down from the other walkers?
Datshiane Navanayagam and Hamza Yassin visit Milford Haven, 30 years on from the Sea Empress oil spill, to meet those who led the emergency response and to learn how the area has recovered.
Highlights from five Premier League games, including Manchester City against Newcastle United. Elsewhere, Aston Villa host Leeds, Burnley travel to Chelsea and Brentford take on Brighton.
Coverage of day 16 of the Milano Cortina 2026 Olympic Winter Games.

World War II drama in which an RAF pilot heads a mission behind enemy lines to destroy a secret German weapon. [1970]

The closing ceremony of the 2026 Winter Olympics, held at Verona Arena.
Comedy drama based on the true story of 12 Yorkshire ladies who find a compelling way to raise money for charity: a nude calendar. Stars Helen Mirren and Julie Walters. [2003]
The women of an isolated religious colony must decide how to respond to brutal events. Contains some strong language, sexual violence and some upsetting scenes. [2022]

2/6. Michael's neighbour Clive is suspicious about the mysterious goings-on in Michael's shed. Contains some strong language.

programmes.show_name: What We Do in the Shadows
programmes.show_description: 9/11. The vampires get blamed for a murder and must find a way back to Staten Island. Contains very strong language and prolonged violent scenes.

programmes.show_name: What We Do in the Shadows
programmes.show_description: 10/11. The vampires go to an office party to celebrate Guillermo's promotion. Contains strong language.

programmes.show_name: The A to Z of TV Gardening
programmes.show_description: 15/25. A look at some of the BBC's most popular gardening programmes and personalities, presented by Carol Kirkwood. Carol explores subjects that all begin with the letter O.

Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

1/30. Game show in which players score points by answering questions correctly while avoiding the Impossible answers.
5/45. Jason Manford hosts the quiz where it's not just about finding the right answer, it's finding the best answer that counts.
11/25. Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where being in control is everything. Who will emerge as the boss and walk away with the cash?

Archaeologist Ben Robinson reveals the story of this Devon coastal gem's transformation from fishing village to romantic Victorian seaside resort.

Paul Martin and experts Adam Partridge and Anita Manning are at Crathes Castle in Aberdeenshire. Anita hones in on some Wemyss pottery with a local interest.

programmes.show_name: New: Richard Osman's House of Games
programmes.show_description: 76/100. Michelle Ackerley, Katie Derham, Karen Hauer and Geoff Norcott test their trivia skills.

Zhanna Bezpiatchuk reports from Ukraine's capital Kyiv on four years of war, death, destruction, resilience and hope.
5/6. Paul follows the eastward course of the river South Esk from its source in the hills above Glen Clova to the extraordinary Montrose Basin, and on to the sea.
23/31. Clive Myrie hosts as four more contenders answer questions on specialist subjects, including the London 2012 Olympic Games and British waterfowl and wading birds.
